content: For the 2024â€“2025 academic year, BS Software Engineering students must choose 4 technical elective courses (typically 12 units). Prerequisites do not count as electives, and students may not take classes from campuses they are not admitted to. Electives can be chosen across tracks such as AI/Machine Learning, Algorithms, Cloud Computing, Cybersecurity, Data Science, Embedded Systems, and Mobile Development, and some courses are AMP-eligible so they can count toward both BS and MS degrees.

metadata.requirement: Students must choose 4 technical elective courses (typically 12 units)
metadata.important_note: Prerequisites do NOT count as electives. You cannot take classes from a campus you are not admitted to.
metadata.amp_note: AMP (Accelerated Master's Program) eligible courses can count toward both BS and MS degrees

content: SIE 477 - Introduction to Biomedical Informatics (3 units) introduces biomedical informatics concepts. Prerequisite: ECE 175. Advanced standing is required. Offered in fall on the main campus only. Counts toward the Data Science technical elective track and is AMP-eligible.

SIE 473 - Designing Cyber Resilient Systems (3 units) focuses on designing systems resilient to cyber threats. Prerequisite: SIE 471. Advanced standing required. Listed as on hold for the main campus and not offered online or in Yuma. AMP-eligible.

SIE 472 - INSuRE (3 units) is a cybersecurity-focused course that requires SIE 471 and advanced standing. It is typically offered in spring on main campus, online, and at Yuma. Counts toward the Cybersecurity track and is AMP-eligible.

SIE 471 - Systems Cyber Security Engineering (3 units) introduces systems-level cybersecurity engineering. No formal prerequisite is listed, but advanced standing is required. Offered in fall on main campus and Yuma. Counts toward the Cybersecurity track and is AMP-eligible.

SIE 458 - Model Based Systems Engineering (3 units) covers model-based approaches to systems engineering. Prerequisite: SIE 454A. Advanced standing required. Offered in fall on main campus and spring in Yuma. Counts toward the Embedded Systems track and is AMP-eligible.

SIE 454A - The Systems Engineering Process (3 units) introduces the systems engineering process. No prerequisite is listed, but advanced standing is required. Offered in fall on main campus and fall/spring in Yuma. Counts toward the Embedded Systems track and is AMP-eligible.

SIE 433 - Fundamentals of Data Science for Engineers (3 units) introduces data science concepts for engineers. Prerequisite: SIE 305 or equivalent. Advanced standing required. Offered in spring on main campus and fall in Yuma. Counts toward AI/Machine Learning and Data Science tracks and is AMP-eligible.

metadata.course_title: Fund of Data Science for Engineers

content: SIE 431 - Simulation Modeling & Analysis (3 units) focuses on simulation modeling and analysis techniques. Prerequisite: SIE 305. Advanced standing is required. Offered fall/spring on main campus and fall/spring/summer at Yuma. Counts toward AI/Machine Learning and Algorithms tracks and is AMP-eligible.

SIE 430 - Engineering Stats (3 units) is an engineering-focused statistics course. Prerequisite: SIE 305. Advanced standing required. Offered in fall on main campus and Yuma. Counts toward the AI/Machine Learning track and is AMP-eligible.

SIE 415 - Technical Sales & Marketing (3 units) focuses on sales and marketing in technical fields. No prerequisite is listed, but advanced standing is required. Offered fall/spring on main campus and Yuma. Counts toward the Data Science track and is AMP-eligible.

SIE 370 - Embedded Computer Systems (4 units) covers embedded computer systems concepts. No prerequisite is listed, but advanced standing is required. Offered in spring on main campus. Counts toward the Embedded Systems track and is not AMP-eligible.

SFWE 492 - Directed Research (3 units) allows students to engage in supervised research. No prerequisite is listed, but department consent is required. Offered fall/spring/summer on main campus, online, and Yuma. AMP-eligible and can count as a technical elective with advisor approval.

SFWE 410 - Cloud Native (temporarily SIE 496) (3 units) focuses on cloud-native software development. Prerequisite: SFWE 302 and advanced standing. Listed as coming soon on main campus, online, and Yuma. Counts toward the Cloud Computing track and is AMP-eligible.

SFWE 409 - Principles of Cloud Computing (3 units) covers foundational cloud computing concepts. Prerequisite: ECE 369A or CSC 252, with advanced standing required. Listed as coming soon on main campus, online, and Yuma. Counts toward the Cloud Computing track and is AMP-eligible.

SFWE 411 - Software for Industrial Control Systems (3 units) focuses on software for industrial control systems. Prerequisite: ECE 275 and advanced standing. Offered in fall on main campus, online, and Yuma. Counts toward the Embedded Systems track and is not AMP-eligible.

LING 438 - Computational Linguistics (3 units) introduces computational methods for language. No prerequisite or special restriction is listed. Offered in fall on main campus only. Not AMP-eligible and not tied to a specific SFWE track by default.

ISTA 452 - Advanced Game Development (3 units) focuses on advanced topics in game development. No prerequisite or restriction is listed. Marked as coming soon on main campus, not offered online or in Yuma. Not AMP-eligible.

ISTA 450 - Artificial Intelligence (3 units) covers AI principles. Prerequisite: MATH 243 or instructor consent. Offered fall/spring on main campus. Not AMP-eligible and counts toward the AI/Machine Learning track.

ISTA 431 - Data Warehousing and Analytics in the Cloud (3 units) covers cloud-based data warehousing and analytics. No prerequisite or restriction is listed. Offered fall/spring/summer on main campus and fall online. Counts toward the Data Science track and is not AMP-eligible.

metadata.course_title: Data Warehousing and Analytics in the Cloud

content: ISTA 425 - Algorithms for Games (3 units) focuses on algorithms relevant to game development. No prerequisite or restriction is listed. Marked as coming soon on main campus and not offered online or in Yuma. Not AMP-eligible and counts toward the Algorithms track.

ISTA 421 - Intro to Machine Learning (3 units) introduces machine learning concepts. Prerequisites: (ESOC 214 or ISTA 116 or DATA 363) and (ISTA 130 or CSC 110). Offered fall/spring on main campus. Counts toward AI/Machine Learning and Data Science tracks and is not AMP-eligible.

metadata.prerequisites: (ESOC 214 or ISTA 116 or DATA 363) and (ISTA 130 or CSC 110)

content: ISTA 329 - Introduction to Web Design & Development (3 units) covers basic web design and development. No prerequisites or restrictions. Offered fall/spring on main campus and online. Not AMP-eligible.

ISTA 322 - Data Engineering (3 units) focuses on data engineering concepts. Prerequisite: ECE 175, ISTA 130, or CSC 110. Offered fall/spring on main campus and online. Counts toward the Data Science track and is not AMP-eligible.

ISTA 321 - Data Mining and Discovery (3 units) covers data mining techniques. Prerequisites: ISTA 116, ESOC 214, or equivalent, or consent of instructor. Offered fall/spring/summer on main campus and online. Counts toward the Data Science track and is not AMP-eligible.

metadata.prerequisites: ISTA 116, ESOC 214, or equivalent; or consent of instructor

content: GAME 426 - Game Artificial Intelligence (3 units) covers AI techniques used in games. Prerequisite: ISTA 350, ECE 373, CSC 210, or instructor consent. Offered in spring on main campus. Counts toward the AI/Machine Learning track and is not AMP-eligible.

metadata.prerequisites: ISTA 350 or ECE 373 or CSC 210 or instructor consent.

content: GAME 351 - Introduction to Game Development with Unity (3 units) teaches game development using Unity. Prerequisite: ECE 175, ISTA 130, or CSC 110. Offered fall/spring/summer on main campus and online. Not AMP-eligible.

metadata.course_title: Introduction to Game Development with Unity

content: ESOC 318 - Disruptive Technologies (3 units) explores disruptive technologies and their impacts. No prerequisites or restrictions. Offered fall/spring/summer on main campus, online, and spring in Yuma. Not AMP-eligible.
ENTR 400 (387) - Tech Ventures (3 units) focuses on technology entrepreneurship. Recommended prerequisite: ENTR 296. Offered in spring on main campus. Not AMP-eligible.

ECE 479 - Artificial Intelligence (3 units) covers AI from an ECE perspective. Prerequisite: ECE 373 or SIE 277. Advanced standing required. Offered in spring on main campus. Counts toward AI/Machine Learning and Data Science tracks and is AMP-eligible.

ECE 478 - Fundamentals of Computer Networks (3 units) covers networking fundamentals. Prerequisites: ECE 275 and ECE 310. Advanced standing required. Offered in fall on main campus. Counts toward Cybersecurity and Mobile Development tracks and is AMP-eligible.

ECE 474A - Computer Aided Logic (3 units) covers computer-aided logic design. Prerequisites: ECE 274A and ECE 275. Advanced standing required. Offered in fall on main campus. Counts toward the Embedded Systems track and is AMP-eligible.

ECE 471 - Fundamentals of Information Theory & Network Security (3 units) covers information theory and network security. No formal prerequisite is listed, but advanced standing is required. Offered in spring on main campus. Counts toward the Cybersecurity track and is AMP-eligible.

ECE 466 - Knowledge System Engineering (3 units) focuses on engineering knowledge-based systems. No prerequisite is listed, but advanced standing is required. Offered in spring on main campus. Not AMP-eligible.

ECE 462 - Computer Architecture & Design (3 units) covers computer architecture and design principles. Prerequisite: ECE 369A. Advanced standing required. Offered in spring on main campus. Counts toward the Embedded Systems track and is AMP-eligible.

ECE 429 - Digital Signal Processing (3 units) covers DSP principles. Prerequisites: ECE majors and ECE 340A. Advanced standing required. Offered fall/spring on main campus and fall online. Counts toward Algorithms and Embedded Systems tracks and is AMP-eligible.

ECE 413 - Web Development & the IoT (3 units) covers web development and Internet of Things applications. Prerequisite: ECE 275. Advanced standing required. Offered in fall on main campus. Counts toward the Mobile Development track and is AMP-eligible.

ECE 372A - Microprocessor Organization (4 units) covers microprocessor organization and design. Prerequisites: ECE 274A, (ECE 207 or 220), and ECE 275. Advanced standing required. Offered fall/spring on main campus and spring online. Counts toward the Embedded Systems track and is not AMP-eligible.

ECE 330B - Computational Techniques (3 units) introduces computational methods for engineers. Prerequisites: ECE majors; MATH 223, MATH 254, PHYS 143, PHYS 241, and ECE 175. Advanced standing required. Offered in spring on main campus. Counts toward the Algorithms track and is not AMP-eligible.

metadata.prerequisites: Majors; MATH 223, MATH 254, PHYS 143, PHYS 241 & ECE 175

content: ECE 310* - Applications of Engineering Math (4 units) covers applications of engineering mathematics. Prerequisites: MATH 254, (ECE 207 or 220), and ECE 275. Advanced standing required. Offered fall/spring on main campus and fall online. Not AMP-eligible.

CYBV 480 - Cyber Warfare (3 units) covers concepts related to cyber warfare. Prerequisites: CYBV 326 and CYBV 385 or instructor consent. Offered fall/spring online and in Yuma. Counts toward the Cybersecurity track and is not AMP-eligible.

metadata.prerequisites: CYBV 326 and CYBV 385 or consent of instructor.

content: CYBV 474 - Advanced Analytics for Security Operations (3 units) focuses on analytics for security operations. No prerequisites or restrictions listed. Offered fall/spring online and in Yuma. Counts toward the Cybersecurity track and is not AMP-eligible.

CYBV 473 - Violent Python (3 units) uses Python for cybersecurity applications. No prerequisites or restrictions listed. Offered fall/spring online and in Yuma. Counts toward the Cybersecurity track and is not AMP-eligible.

CYBV 454 - Malware Threats & Analysis (3 units) focuses on malware threats and analysis techniques. No prerequisites or restrictions listed. Offered fall/spring online and in Yuma. Counts toward the Cybersecurity track and is not AMP-eligible.

CYBV 435 - Cyber Threat Intelligence (3 units) covers cyber threat intelligence concepts. No prerequisites or restrictions listed. Offered fall/spring/summer online and in Yuma, with main campus availability listed as 'See Advisor'. Counts toward the Cybersecurity track and is not AMP-eligible.

CYBV 400 - Active Cyber Defense (3 units) focuses on active defense strategies in cybersecurity. No prerequisites or restrictions listed. Offered fall/spring online and in Yuma, with main campus availability listed as 'See Advisor'. Counts toward the Cybersecurity track and is not AMP-eligible.

CYBV 385 - Introduction to Cyber Operations (3 units) introduces cyber operations. No prerequisites or restrictions listed. Offered fall/spring/summer online and in Yuma, with main campus availability listed as 'See Advisor'. Counts toward the Cybersecurity track and is not AMP-eligible.

CYBV 312 - Introduction to Security Scripting (3 units) introduces scripting for security. No prerequisites or restrictions listed. Offered fall/spring/summer online and in Yuma, not offered on main campus. Counts toward the Cybersecurity track and is not AMP-eligible.

CYBV 303 - Windows Security Essentials (3 units) covers Windows security fundamentals. No prerequisites or restrictions listed. Offered in fall online and in Yuma, not offered on main campus. Counts toward the Cybersecurity track and is not AMP-eligible.

CYBV 302 - Linux Security Essentials (3 units) covers Linux security fundamentals. No prerequisites or restrictions listed. Offered in fall online and in Yuma, not offered on main campus. Counts toward the Cybersecurity track and is not AMP-eligible.

CSC(V) 471 - Artificial Intelligence (3 units) covers AI concepts for CS majors. Prerequisite: CSC 355 or 345. Offered online in fall and at Yuma in fall. Counts toward the AI/Machine Learning track and is not AMP-eligible.

CSC(V) 372 - Comparative Programming Languages (3 units) studies different programming languages. Prerequisite: CS major and CSC 210. Offered fall/spring on main campus and fall at online/Yuma. Not AMP-eligible.

CSC 477 - Intro to Computer Vision (3 units) introduces computer vision concepts. Prerequisites: CS major; CSC 252, CSC 335, CSC 345, CSC 352, and (MATH 215 or MATH 313). Offered in spring on main campus. Counts toward the AI/Machine Learning track and is not AMP-eligible.

metadata.prerequisites: CS Major; CSC 252, CSC 335, CSC 345, CSC 352 & (MATH 215 or MATH 313)

content: CSC 460 - Database Design (3 units) covers database design principles. Prerequisites: CS major; CSC 335 and CSC 345. Offered fall/spring on main campus and spring/summer online and in Yuma. Not AMP-eligible.

CSC 453 - Compilers and Systems Software (3 units) covers compilers and systems software. Prerequisites: CS major; CSC 252, 345, 352; CSC 372 recommended. Offered fall/spring on main campus. Not AMP-eligible.

CSC 452 - Principles of Operating Systems (3 units) covers operating system concepts. Prerequisites: CS major; CSC 252, CSC 345, and CSC 352. Offered in spring on main campus, online, and in Yuma. Counts toward the Embedded Systems track and is not AMP-eligible.
CSC 444 - Data Visualization (3 units) covers principles and tools for data visualization. Prerequisites: CS major; CSC 335 and CSC 345. Offered fall/spring on main campus. Not AMP-eligible.

CSC 436 - Software Engineering (3 units) focuses on software engineering for CS majors. Prerequisites: CS major; CSC 252, CSC 335, CSC 345, and CSC 352. Offered in fall on main campus. Not AMP-eligible.

metadata.prerequisites: CS Major; CSC 252, CSC 335, CSC 345, and CSC 352.

content: CSC 433 - Computer Graphics (3 units) covers computer graphics concepts. Prerequisites: CS major; CSC 252, 335, 345, 352, and (MATH 215 or 313). Offered fall/spring on main campus. Not AMP-eligible.
CSC 372 - Comparative Programming Languages (3 units) studies different programming languages and paradigms. Prerequisites: CS major and CSC 210. Offered in spring on main campus. Not AMP-eligible.

CSC 352 - Systems Programming and Unix (3 units) covers systems programming concepts in Unix environments. Prerequisites: CS major; CSC 252, 335, 345, 352, and (MATH 215 or 313). Offered fall/spring on main campus. Not AMP-eligible.
CSC 346 - Cloud Computing (3 units) introduces cloud computing concepts. Prerequisite: CSC 120. Offered in fall on main campus. Counts toward the Cloud Computing track and is not AMP-eligible.

CSC 337 - Web Programming (3 units) covers web programming fundamentals. Prerequisite: ECE 175, ISTA 130, or CSC 110. Offered fall/spring on main campus. Counts toward the Mobile Development track and is not AMP-eligible.
